question: In basal-like breast cancer, does downregulation of DUSP4 deactivate the Ras-ERK signaling pathway? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Thus, DUSP4 downregulation activates the Ras-ERK pathway in BLBC, resulting in an attenuated response to anti-cancer chemotherapy
content.source_2: Contrary to prior reports, BLBC exhibited lower DUSP4 promoter methylation and transcriptional signatures consistent with Ras-ERK pathway suppression compared with other breast cancer subtypes
content.source_3: In post-neoadjuvant specimens, tumors with low DUSP4 expression, an ERK phosphatase, showed reduced proliferation and diminished ERK signaling, consistent with deactivation of the Ras-ERK pathway
